q: In Blockchain, if a Sybil attack is initiated on a system that uses the Proof of Work algorithm, then which of the following operations is used to prevent the system from this attack?

a.option: Providing false information to the Sybil system under extreme conditions
Providing false information to the Sybil system under regular conditions
Making the system infeasible for the attack so that it provide false information to a victim node under regular conditions
System cannot be prevented from the attack

q:
In Blockchain, in which of these payout strategies a mining pool need not take into account the following phenomenon:

"There may occur well-formed blocks which are no longer part of the difficulty-wise-longest and well-formed blockchain"
In Blockchain, countermeasures for alternate history attacks has been taken by using multi confirmation waiting. Which of the following is a reason that this attack is still possible?

a.option: It is possible if there are explicit outgoing connections to connected nodes.
It is possible only if the attacker has a high hash-rate.
It is possible if double spend is not allowed.

q: In Blockchain, if you are using elliptic curve cryptography as a part of the signing algorithm, then in which of the following ways you can define the integer multiplication if A is a point on an elliptic curve?

In Blockchain, if you are using elliptic curve cryptography as a part of the signing algorithm and you have to perform the operation n*A = Q, where Q is a point on an elliptic curve, then which of the following can possibly be a private key?

In Blockchain, assume that a validator performs the following steps:

  1. He creates two blocks for the same set of transactions in a Proof of Stake system.
  2. He then claims two sets of transactions fees.

If a signer has signed two of these blocks, then which of these ways can be used to prevent this situation?

a.option: It can be prevented by enabling coin creation by mining.
It can be prevented by requiring storage of currency in vaults.

q: In Blockchain, if two miners try to mine a bitcoin block and both of them complete mining the block at approximately the same time, then what will happen in this case and how will it be solved?

a.option: There will not be any conflicting transaction.
There will be conflicting blocks and one of the blocks will be chosen at random and used.
There will be conflicting blocks and the longest chain of valid blocks will be used. The other branch is ignored.
There will be conflicting blocks and the shortest chain of valid blocks will be used. The other branch is ignored.

q: In Blockchain, which of the following is used to modify a single transaction if you are given a Merkle tree?

a.option: You do not have to recompute anything.

q: In Blockchain, assume that you are given the Merkle root, which is the root of a binary Merkle tree. Which of the following actions can be used to arrive at this figure if you are given transaction hashes?

a.option: Hash all the hashes together to get the root.
Pairs of hashes are hashed together iteratively until only one remain which is the root.
Merkle root is a hash of a single transaction.
Transaction hashes have nothing to do with the Merkle root.

q: In Blockchain, assume that a third party is trying to modify transactions without invalidating the signature on the transaction. What part of the transaction would be modified in this case?

a.option: No such operation can be performed.
The hash of the transaction is modified before it joins the block.
The hash of the transaction is modified after it joins the block.

q:
In Blockchain, assume that you have to design a system that uses Proof-of-Authority for establishing consensus. Which of these rules are likely to be satisfied by the validator in such a system:

1. The identity of the validator must be verified correctly.
2. The eligibility must be challenging to obtain.
3. There must be complete unity in the checks and procedures for establishing authority.

In Blockchain, if it can be calculated that 1 in X hashes may succeed, then what is the value of X considering the following base target for the hash:

0x00000000FFFF0000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000
In Blockchain, which of the following steps can be used to convert the seemingly NP problem of mining of bitcoin into a problem that is definitely in NP?

a.option: The hash sizes should be fixed.
The mining should be turned into a decision problem.

q: In Blockchain, assume that a person has joined a mining pool that uses coinbase and is trying to send a success message after a block has been hashed. When exactly would he send this hash?

a.option: When the block is hashed to the pool's difficulty, which is lower than the Bitcoin mining difficulty
When the block is hashed to the pool's difficulty, which is greater than the Bitcoin mining difficulty
When the block is hashed to the pool's difficulty, which is equivalent to the Bitcoin mining difficulty
When the block is hashed to Bitcoin's difficulty

q: In Blockchain, assume that you need to design a system that can handle coinbase transactions as opposed to regular transactions. In the transaction structure that your system needs to handle, which of the following parameters would not be relevant for a coinbase transaction?

In Blockchain, assume that you are using a stratum mining pool to mine bitcoins. If you need to build the coinbase transaction for a block, then what is the number of parameters that you need to concatenate?
In Blockchain, if you have to design a mining pool which includes the communication between a miner and the mining pool, then which of these features must be performed by the pool?

a.option: Miners should not waste time working on a block that has already been mined.
Miners should not duplicate the work.

q: In Blockchain, assume that you are in the process of mining a bitcoin block. Which of these fields that is a part of the block needs to be present to ensure that transactions cannot be changed once they are part of a block?

In Blockchain, which of the following statements about the bitcoin security is not true:

  1. A public key is usually generated by the sender and the private key is usually generated by the receiver.
  2. The public key cryptography uses separate keys for encrypting and decrypting.
  3. The bitcoin relies on public key cryptography and not shared key cryptography.
In Blockchain, which of these statements about the Merkle root in a block of transactions in bitcoin is correct?

a.option: It is a type of bitcoin transaction.
It is a single hash that presents a summary of all transactions in that block.
It helps in changing a block's nonce causing its fingerprint to change.
It is used in the cryptographic handshake.

q: In Blockchain, which of the following statements about disintermediation is correct?

a.option: It is the process of reducing or eliminating intermediary parties from a transaction.
It is the activity of sending funds with bank as intermediary.
It is a type of computer language.

q: In Blockchain, which of the following fields in a typical block structure contains the previous block’s hash, nonce, and Merkle root?
In Blockchain, which of the following statements about the characteristic of a multi-input transaction and its significance in anonymity is correct?

a.option: The transaction involves multiple addresses from different wallets as input. This supports the anonymity of the sender.
The transaction involves multiple addresses from different wallets as input. This compromises the anonymity of the sender.
The transaction involves multiple addresses from the same wallet as input. This supports the anonymity of the sender.
The transaction involves multiple addresses from the same wallet as input. This compromises the anonymity of the sender.

q: In Blockchain, which of the following reasons behind a bitcoin transaction having two input addresses and two output addresses is correct?

a.option: The network compacted two similar transactions into one to save space.
The user had addresses that when combined formed the perfect amount to fulfill two separate outgoing payments.
The user had two addresses that when combined formed enough amount to make a payment and the leftover was sent to a changed address.

q: In a Blockchain network, assume that all nodes on the network have synchronized their blockchains on 'block number 100'. Meanwhile, four miners from across the world created 'block number 101' roughly at the same time. Which 'block number 101' should be considered as the legit one among the four created blocks?

a.option: The block which wins in the longest chain rule.
The block which wins in the shortest chain rule.
The block which wins the consensus through Proof of Work.
Any of these blocks is picked at random.

q:
In Blockchain, which of these statements for the following rule of Access Control List (ACL) file written in a hyperledger composer application is true:

rule OwnerHasFullAccessToTheirAssets {
    description: ""
    participant(p): "org.acme.sample.SampleParticipant"
    operation: ALL
    resource(r): "org.acme.sample.SampleAsset"
    condition: (r.owner.getIdentifier() === p.getIdentifier())
    action: ALLOW
}

a.option: It allows all participants to submit transactions.
It grants all participants the full access to their assets.
It grants business network administrators full access to user resources and their assets.
It grants business network administrators full access to system resources and their assets.

q:
In Blockchain, which of the following prerequisites must be met to run Iroha daemon:

  1. The Postgres server should be up and running.
  2. A keypair for the peer should be generated.
  3. The image for Iroha should be pulled.
In Blockchain, if an architecture requires a hash starting with 15 zeroes, then which of these would be a good target of the hash achieved by the mining pool designed for this architecture?

a.option: The pool asks for hashes starting with 20 zeroes.
The pool asks for hashes starting with 15 zeroes.
The pool asks for hashes starting with 10 zeroes.
The number of zeroes does not matter.

q: If you are developing a Blockchain system that uses Proof of Work as its consensus algorithm, then which of the following problems can arise due to the usage of this algorithm?

a.option: Larger power consumption of the blockchain network

q: In Blockchain, assume that you want to create a financial application where some transaction-related data is shared with selected entities only. If you are using Amazon Managed Blockchain to create the blockchain network, then which of these blockchain frameworks are you likely to choose to use for your application?
Which of the following is used by a block in a Blockchain network to refer to a block previous to it?

Assume that a Blockchain network of 1000 nodes is undergoing a transaction. What is the number of nodes from the network that must approve a transaction to ensure that there is no chance of adding a false transaction in the block by a third-party through consensus?

a.option: All 1000 nodes must approve for the consensus.

q: In Blockchain, assume that A is a malicious node in the network who has to send node B a few altcoins during a financial transaction. Which of these ways can be used by A to fake and trick B into believing that it has sent the amount?

a.option: B can prevent a transaction from getting confirmed if it hears A broadcasting the transaction on peer-to-peer network.
A can inform B that the transaction is complete as it has got a confirmation and has also entered the blockchain.
A can create a valid transaction from someone’s account to B’s account.

q: In Blockchain, any new transaction on hyperledger follows three processes. Which of these three processes involves gossip?

a.option: New transactions are submitted to the orderer.
New block containing new transaction gets created by the orderer on the blockchain.
The block gets delivered to all peers by the orderer.

q:
In Blockchain, which of the following tasks are performed by an orderer in hyperledger fabric:

  1. Run chaincode
  2. Order transactions
  3. Create blocks
  4. Commit transactions

In Blockchain, which of the following hyperledger composer modules will you use to expose a deployed business network so that it can automatically generate a REST API for the assets, participants, and transactions in that business network?
In Blockchain, which of the following statements about the composer-runtime module in Hyperledger is not true?

a.option: It can execute transaction processor functions developed by users.
It can persist transactions or participants in registries.
It must be hosted in a runtime container to bind the runtime code in the underlying blockchain platform.

q:
Which of the following events takes place when you deploy a business network definition to a Blockchain platform using Hyperledger composer:

  1. Hyperledger composer runtime is deployed in the form of a chaincode or a smart contract.
  2. The source code of chaincode or smart contract is generated.
  3. Operations on the deployed business network are exposed by runtime to client applications via a set of APIs.
Which of these steps is necessary to create an application on top of business Blockchain network using Hyperledger composer?

a.option: Describe assets, participants, and transactions inside the model files.
Define rules for sharing and privacy inside the access control lists.
Any additional business requirements are implemented in transaction processors.

q: If your Blockchain powered business requires an agreed system of records to be available across the Blockchain network, then which of the following acid tests should it pass?
In Blockchain, which of the following statements is not a feature of IBM Hyperledger Fabric?

a.option: Membership and access rights for blocks can be defined collectively.
Confidential transactions can be carried out.
It relies on mining and expensive computation to assure transactions.
A business process can be automated through smart contracts.

q: In Blockchain, what would be the minimum number of nodes needed to keep a track of all transactions to prevent double spend in a peer-to-peer network?
In Blockchain, which of these statements about a chaincode is true?

a.option: Chaincode initializes and manages ledger state through transactions submitted by applications.
A chaincode cannot invoke another chaincode to access its state.

q: Which of the following representations of a transaction processor function in IBM Blockchain Platform is correct?
In Blockchain, a decentralized digital cash network was considered as not being realizable until the creation of bitcoin. What could be the possible technical reasons for the same?

a.option: Double-spend issue was tough to solve.
State of balance consensus was difficult to reach.
Network peers were not fault tolerant when it came to differing transaction data.
Transaction data was difficult to propagate to all peers.

q: In Blockchain, assume that in a transaction between Alice and John, if Alice gives a unit of cryptocurrency to John, then which of the following is most likely used to sign the transaction file?
In Blockchain, which of these statements about the regulator is true?

a.option: It is possible to prohibit regulators from conducting transactions on a blockchain network.
It is the duty of a regulator to issue different types of certificates required to run a permissioned blockchain.

q:
In a permissioned Blockchain network, if a party A transfers an asset to party B, then which of these statements for the following participants is true:

  1. Party C in the same network who is not involved in the transaction
  2. An auditor who joins the network

a.option:
1. Party C can see that Party A and Party B have transacted but it cannot see the details of the asset transfer.
2. Auditor can see the full details of all the transactions on the network using digital certificates.

1. Party C cannot see that Party A and Party B have transacted.
2. Auditor can only see that transaction has happened but cannot see its complete details.

1. Party C can see that Party A and Party B have transacted including the details of the asset transfer.
2. Auditor cannot see the full details of all the transactions.

1. Party C cannot see that Party A and Party B have transacted.
2. Auditor can see the full details of all transactions on the network using digital certificates.

q: In Blockchain, if a Docker Host is added as a worker node in a Cello cluster, then on which of these ports should the Docker daemon be made accessible?

In Blockchain, which of these commands will you use to check for existing containers in the hyperledger fabric developer environment if you want to use Docker to manually create and join peers to a new channel?
Assume that you are establishing a private Blockchain and designing an integrated security system. Which of the following rules about access control of this infrastructure is valid?

a.option: Sensitive information should not be accessed by anyone.
Sensitive information should not be accessed by anyone except authorized personnel.
Sensitive information should not be accessed by anyone except root users.
Sensitive information should not be accessed by anyone except root users and administrators.

q: Assume that you are creating a public Blockchain system. You find that there is a time-gap for any transaction that occurs before it is verified and synced with all the nodes in the system and then written to the system. Which of these tasks can be done in this time gap?

a.option: The next transaction can be initiated, but cannot come to completion until the previous one has been written.
The next transaction can be initiated and can continue to completion
A central entity can verify the current transaction details, and then give the go ahead to future transactions.
You are not supposed to do any of these tasks in this time gap.

q: In Blockchain, assume that you have a BIP draft that proposes changes to the transaction validation process. If you find that the current BIP is flawed and can be exploited by certain techniques, then which of these types of BIP would it come under?

a.option: As many keys as there are objects in "accounts"
Twice as many keys as there are objects in "accounts"

q: In Blockchain, if you move your system from SHA 256 to SHA 1024, then what would be the number of additional rounds that the system is required to run after the upgrade?

In Blockchain, a trader offers to exchange XRP (Ripple) and an issued currency. In order to modify the significant digits that would be truncated in the exchange rate, which of the following values would you modify?

a.option: The TickSize of the currency set by the issuer
The TickSize of the currency set by the trader
The smaller of the two TickSizes for the currency, set by either the issuer or the trader
The larger of the two TickSizes for the currency, set by either the issuer or the trader

q: In a Bitcoin transaction system, how often ideally should a public key be used so as to ensure the user has financial privacy?
In Blockchain, which of the following ways is used to establish consensus for verified transactions in business blockchain ledgers?

a.option: Addresses are not tied to the identity of users.
Transactions are not tied to the identity of users.
Transaction data is transmitted and forwarded by nodes to a random set of nodes.
The usage of wallet services does not compromise anonymity.

q:
Which of these steps would take place in a process where a user wants to send money to another user over a public Blockchain network:

  1. The transaction is represented as a block.
  2. The transaction (block) is broadcasted to every party in the network.
  3. The parties in the network approve if the transaction is valid.
  4. The transaction (block) gets added to the chain.

a.option: The related chaincode gets called through a REST API.
A new ledger gets created for the related block.
A function in chaincode gets called which further reads and writes values to ledger.
A new block is mined and added to the blockchain.

q: Which of the following tasks can a Blockchain miner do if he solves the cryptographic puzzle as part of the mining process?

a.option: He is allowed to build a block.
He is allowed to build a unit of currency.

q: Which of these containers is used by IBM Bluemix Container Service on the cloud to launch a Blockchain network?
What is the IBM Blockchain platform built upon?
In a Blockchain network, how are the business rules of the transactions recorded?

a.option: They are recorded in encoded form in consistent hash tables.
They are recorded in encoded form in the smart contracts.
They are recorded on servers built with consistent hashing.

q:

  1. Each block has a digital fingerprint of the previous block.
  2. Each node has shared ledger.
  3. Participants know where the assets came from but how its ownership has changed over time is not revealed.
In Blockchain, assume that large price movements have been observed in bitcoin in a single day and the overall trend is upward. How does this behavior affect the viability of hedging?

a.option: It can make it more viable.

q: In Blockchain, which of the following statements about the Proof of Authority is not true?

a.option: It can be considered as inherently centralized.
There should always be more than the required number of validators.
There should be a standard and robust process for identifying validators.

q: Which of the following is not a type of blockchain?
Which of the following is a key innovation in the Blockchain technology?

a.option: It is a digitally distributed ledger.
Each ‘block’ is uniquely connected to the previous blocks via a digital signature.
It allows its participant to transfer assets across the Internet without the need for a centralized third party.

q: Which of the following statements about Blockchain is not true?

a.option: A global network of computers jointly manages the blockchain.
A central authority owns the blockchain and keeps copies of it at different nodes to make it tamper-proof.

q: In Blockchain, which of the following statements about the public key is not true?

a.option: It is a long randomly-generated string of numbers.
It is the address of a user on the blockchain.
Transactions sent across the network are identified by the public key.

It does not manage agreements between parties.

a.option: The “previousHash” of the current block is equal to the “Hash” of the previous block.
The “Hash” of the current block is equal to the calculated “Hash” of the current block.
Repeat these checks for all blocks staring from index 1.

  2. It is decentralized.
  3. Restriction on the number of people joining the network

  2. Scalable distributed consensus systems

a.option: It is a hybrid of the Proof of Work and Proof of Stake.
New blocks contain data such as the transaction root.
A random group of validating nodes are required to sign a new block.
The mining fees are split among the miners who have found the block and nodes that helped in signing the block into existence.

q: In Blockchain, which of the following statements about Byzantine Fault Tolerance is true?

a.option: It implies no restrictions and makes no assumptions about the kind of behavior a node can have.
Its tolerance is required in many other systems whose actions depend on the results of a large amount of sensors.
The blockchain is Byzantine Fault Tolerant as long as the number of false transactions do not exceed one third of the total transactions.
Making blockchain decentralized is the probabilistic solution to the Byzantine Generals Problem.

q: Which of the following is a type of blockchain network?
What is the advantage of using a blockchain?

In Blockchain, which of these types of consensus algorithms uses a particular tactic to cover transparency into the whole network?

a.option: It is the characteristic which defines a system that tolerates the class of failures that belong to the Byzantine Generals’ Problem.
It is the data variance which tolerates the class of failures that belong to the Byzantine Generals’ Problem.
It is the characteristic which defines a system that tolerates the percentage of data error that belong to the Byzantine Generals’ Problem.
It is the characteristic which defines a system that tolerates the unreliability percentage that belong to the Byzantine Generals’ Problem.

a.option: These are valid and verified blocks which are not a part of the main chain (the longest chain).
These blocks are produced by building on a block that is no longer the active tip of a chain.

q:
Which of the following statements about a nonce in a blockchain are correct:

  2. The value of nonce is under the user's control and can vary for a particular block.
  3. A nonce has a fixed value for each block.
  4. The value of a nonce is dependent on the value of the block number.

By using the index of its previous block
By using the block-header of its previous block

  2. It is a mechanism used to introduce bitcoins into the system.
  3. It is a mechanism that allows blockchain to decentralize security.

q: Which of the following statements about the blockchain transaction process is incorrect?

a.option: Transactions are valid when consensus is met
Digital signature is created using a private key
Nodes compete to solve a problem
New blocks use the hash of the first block

q:
Which of the following statements about PoW (Proof of Work) are true:

  1. It is a consensus strategy used in the Blockchain network.
  2. It is a replication algorithm to tolerate Byzantine faults.
  3. In PoW, each node of the network is required to calculate a hash value of the block header.
  4. The PoW procedure is referred to as mining in Bitcoin.
Which of the following statements about a blockchain and a relational database is correct?

a.option: A blockchain overperforms a relational database in both efficiency and consistency.
A relational database overperforms a blockchain in both efficiency and consistency.
A blockchain overperforms a relational database in efficiency but not in consistency.
A blockchain overperforms a relational database in consistency but not in efficiency.
